result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber release for work. Credit for 3 days

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Davis

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered a fine of $200.00 PLUS all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including the DV surcharge) by 9/26/2019. Failure to pay will result in 30 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. Court grants Huber release for work.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. State complied with victim notification.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Received and Filed, Pretrial Services Supervision Report.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
After confirming with clerk, both signature bonds ($500 and $200) should be REINSTATED per 2-5-19 entry. gj

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests status conference.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for February 21, 2019 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200 sig bond) gj
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record,   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited.The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report; Received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report; Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing. Court is currently in trial on another matter. Defense counsel would also like additional time to negotiate an offer. Court grants request. All parties are advised effective January 7, 2019  this case will be assigned to the Honorable David Feiss, Branch 46, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Discover and Offer was just provided. Defense requests adjourned plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joshua D. Taggatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant late to court. Court issues warning. 
Court addressed good JusticePoint Report and encouraged the defendant to continue the good work.
  Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 3 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Joseph C Davis in court with attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Defendant Joseph C Davis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 15, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Scheduling Conference scheduled June 17, 2015 at 8:30am, Branch 4
